text: Karin Kock-Lindberg, n√©e Kock, born 2 July 1891, dead 28 July 1976, was a Swedish social democrat politician and professor of economics. In 1947 she became the first woman to hold a Ministerial position in Sweden. She also became the first female professor of national economy in Sweden. She was known as Karin Kock-Lindberg after marrying lawyer Hugo Lindberg in 1936. == References == Category:1891 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Swedish economists Category:Government ministers of Sweden Category:Swedish academics Category:Swedish scientists
title: Karin Kock-Lindberg
